answers.answer: It is a tiny hemorrhage on the back of the eye that can be associated with things glaucoma or hypertension or diabetes.  It depends on the size and location.  Call the optometrist to see what exactly he suspects.  If just one flame hemorrahge then there should be no major concerns but just a good reason to have a complete checkup with an ophthalmologist.  Consider it a minor finding that can help you to get a good exam and help take preventative measures if needed to avoid real problems in the future.  Good Luck.MJK MD
